div1.p: Original. 3038 In the United States District Court For the Western District of Washinton. Northern Division.
In the matter of the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Return of Respondent

figure.p: Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Jun 14 1915 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk By Evy Deputy.

div1.p: Alfred H. Lundin Prosecuting Attorney, 1116 Alaska Building, Seattle. Attorney for Respondent.
In the United States District Court of the Western District of Washinton Northern Division
In the Matter of the Petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf for No.3038 Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Motion to Quash Writ.

Comes now the respondent and moves the court to quash the writ heretofore issued in the above entitled casue and to dismiss the above entitled proceeding and to remand the petitioner Francis Stephen Medcraf to the custody of Rober T. Hodge, Sheriff of King County, Washington. This motion is based upon the record and pleadings herein.
Dated at Seattle, Washington, this 28thday of June, 1915.
Attorneys for Respondent.
Original. 3038 In the United States District Court For the Western District of Washinton. Northern Division.
In the matter of the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Return of Respondent

figure.p: Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Jul 2 1915 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk By Eml 2x Deputy

div1.p:
Alfred H. Lundin Frank P. Helsell Attorneys for Respondent.
1116-24 Alaska Bld., Seattle, King County, Wn.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington. Northern Division.
In the matter of the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Write of Habeas Corpus.
Judgment And Order Remanding Petitioner

This cause Coming on for hearing on the 1st day of September, 1915, upon th epetition of Francis Stephen Medcraf for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and the cause having been submitted to the Court for final decision upon the return of the respondent, Robert T. Hodge, as sheriff of King County, Washington, and upon the motion of said respondent, Robert T. Hodge, to quash the Writ heretofore issued inthe above entitled case and to dismiss the above entitled proceedings, and after argument of counsel, the Court being fully advised in the premises, and having filed its decision in writing denying the prayer of the petition, finds that the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf does not state facts sufficent to entitle the said petititoner to a Writ of Habeas Corpus or to his discharge from the custody of said respondent, Robert T. Hodge, for the reason that the law of the State of Washington complained of is not in violation of the Constitution of the United States or the Fifth Amendment of the Constitution of the United States, or the Fourteenth Amendment of the Constitution of the United States.

Now, therefore, it is ordered and decreed That the petition of Francis Stephen Medcraf be dismised and denied and the motion of the said respondent to quash the writ heretofore issued be granted and the petitioner, Francis Stephen Medcraf, be and he
hereby is, remanded to the custody of Robert T. Hodge, as Sheriff of King County, Washington. Is white pettition has sheriff and A ephs are uncalled
Done in open Court this 30th day of September 1915.
Judge
